description: The TT16 file is created once you save your tax return in TurboTax Canada. It is the main file type used by TurboTax Canada and is primarily utilized for three purposes:

Tax return file extensions used by TurboTax Canada reflect the year of the tax data they contain. Tax returns for the 2015 year use the .TT15 extension, returns for the 2014 year use the .TT14 extension, and so on.
NOTE: The U.S. version of TurboTax 2016 saves files with a .TAX2016 file extension.
